    Research

    Selected projects:

    Programmable microfluidics with light-controlled active matter

    Active-matter-driven programmable microfluidics for cell transport, sorting, and mixing

    Active healing of microtubule–motor networks

    Geometry- and stress-controlled repair with a bifurcation in healing outcomes

    Image-based motility and stress inference in tissues

    Extract cell velocity and stress from static segmented images

    Speech-driven virus transport

    Space–time distancing rules from flow-resolved models of speech/breathing

    Thin-film singularity: formation and healing of annular films

    Universal thinning dynamics and bubble entrainment in healed threads

    Diffusiophoresis in complex fluids

    Charged drops and interacting particles in solute gradients

    Magnetized liquid-metal films for fusion devices

    Finite-conductivity effects overturn classical stability expectations
